content:
Yes, certain types of feedback are more valuable than others. Here are some examples of feedback you should try to get from your users:

1. Bug reports: Encourage users to report any bugs or issues they encounter within the app. It's essential to respond quickly to fix issues that affects the app's usability. 2. Feature requests: Users who use the app regularly have a better understanding of their experience while they use it. Encourage them to share their ideas or any features they would like to see in future updates. 3. Complaints: Complaints help you identify areas where the app might need improvement, or where users are experiencing frustrations. 4. Positive feedback: Positive feedback can help to build brand loyalty and encourage users to share the app with others. Users who love your product are one of your best channels of promotion. By collecting feedback on bug reports, feature requests, complaints, and positive feedback, you can make the improvements that matter most to your users. Making these changes will also make the app more valuable to its users, making them more likely to continue using it and recommending it to friends and family.
